Hi,

I managed to get an axisymmetric counter flow flame simulated by
"translating" the python examples to c/c++ by using the class
"AxiStagnFlow" instead of "StFlow". 

For premixed flames (unstrained, no stagnation point, burner
stabilized) it is also working, but not for freely propagating flames
(where you search for flame velocities). 

If you want I can send you the source. 

ulf

--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, Julien De Charentenay
<julien.decharentenay@u...> wrote:
> Hi,
> 
> I have been trying in the past week to run premixed/counter flow
flames. 
> I managed to run the python examples without much troubles; but I am 
> more interested in using c++ to simulate the flames.
> 
> Is there any c++ examples that I could use? I tried flame.cpp but it 
> seems out-of-date and incomplete.
> 
> Thanks in advance,
> Julien
